020package com.bewsoftware.utils.io;
021
022import java.io.*;
023import java.util.*;
024import java.util.stream.Collectors;
025
026/**
027 * This class implements a console with benefits.
028 * <p>
029 * Apart from writing to and reading from the console, you can also write to
030 * a file.
031 *
032 * @implNote
033 * Once the ConsolIO object is closed, any further calls to any of the methods:
034 * append, appendln, print, println, flush, newScanner, readLine, or
035 * readPassword,
036 * will cause an {@link IOException}.
037 *
038 * @author <a href="mailto:bw.opensource@yahoo.com">Bradley Willcott</a>
039 *
040 * @since 1.0.7
041 * @version 2.1.0
042 */
043public final class ConsoleIO implements Display, Input
044{
045
046    private static final String CLOSED = "ConsoleIO is closed.";
047
048    /**
049     * Stores the singleton of each {@link Writer} object related to each
050     * specific instance of {@link PrintWriter} associated with a
051     * {@code filename}.
052     */
053    private static final List<WriterInstance> WRITERS = new ArrayList<>();
054
055    private final boolean blank;
056
057    private final Console console;
058
059    private int debugLevel = 0;
060
061    private int displayLevel = 0;
062
063    private Exception exception;
064
065    private PrintWriter file;
066
067    private final String filename;
068
069    private Formatter formatter;
070
071    private final String linePrefix;
072
073    private boolean open;
074
075    private PrintWriter out;
076
077    private StringBuilder sb;
078
079    /**
080     * Instantiates a "blank console".
081     * <p>
082     * All output is thrown away.
083     * <p>
084     * For use by factory method.
085     */
086    private ConsoleIO()
087    {
088        this.file = null;
089        this.out = null;
090        this.linePrefix = "";
091        this.open = true;
092        this.blank = true;
093        this.filename = null;
094        this.console = null;
095    }
096
097    /**
098     * Instantiates a fully configured "console display".
099     * <p>
100     * All output goes to the system console.
101     * <p>
102     * For use by factory method.
103     *
104     * @param linePrefix text to prepend to each line
105     */
106    private ConsoleIO(final String linePrefix)
107    {
108        this.open = true;
109        this.file = null;
110        this.filename = null;
111
112        console = System.console();
113
114        if (console != null)
115        {
116            this.out = console.writer();
117        } else
118        {
119            this.out = new PrintWriter(System.out);
120        }
121
122        this.linePrefix = linePrefix;
123        clear();
124        this.blank = false;
125    }
126
127    /**
128     * Instantiates a type of display based on the parameters: {@code filename}
129     * and {@code withConsole}.
130     *
131     * @implSpec
132     * If {@code filename} is not {@code null} and not {@code isBlank()}, then
133     * the file will be opened/created. If the file exists, it will be
134     * truncated.
135     * If successful, a copy of all text will be appended to this file.
136     * <p>
137     * If {@code withConsole} is {@code true}, then the System console will be
138     * sent a copy of all text.
139     * <p>
140     * For use by factory method.
141     *
142     * @param linePrefix  text to prepend to each line
143     * @param filename    the file to output to
144     * @param withConsole whether or not to output to the console, if any
145     */
146    private ConsoleIO(final String linePrefix, final String filename, final boolean withConsole)
147    {
148        this.open = true;
149        boolean lBlank;
150
151        if (withConsole)
152        {
153            this.console = System.console();
154
155            if (this.console != null)
156            {
157                this.out = this.console.writer();
158            } else
159            {
160                this.out = new PrintWriter(System.out);
161            }
162
163            this.linePrefix = linePrefix;
164            clear();
165            lBlank = false;
166        } else
167        {
168            this.console = null;
169            this.out = null;
170            this.linePrefix = "";
171            lBlank = true;
172        }
173
174        if (filename != null && !filename.isBlank())
175        {
176            this.filename = filename;
177            int idx = WRITERS.indexOf(filename);
178
179            try
180            {
181                if (idx == -1)
182                {
183                    WRITERS.add(new WriterInstance(filename));
184                    idx = WRITERS.indexOf(filename);
185                }
186
187                this.file = WRITERS.get(idx).addUsage();
188                lBlank = false;
189            } catch (IOException ex)
190            {
191                exception = ex;
192            }
193        } else
194        {
195            this.file = null;
196            this.filename = null;
197        }
198
199        this.blank = lBlank;
200    }
201
202    /**
203     * Provides a version of the ConsolIO that displays nothing.
204     *
205     * @return new blank Display
206     */
207    public static Display blankDisplay()
208    {
209        return new ConsoleIO();
210    }
211
212    /**
213     * Provides a fully configured console display.
214     *
215     * @param linePrefix text to prepend to each line
216     *
217     * @return new Display
218     */
219    public static Display consoleDisplay(final String linePrefix)
220    {
221        return new ConsoleIO(linePrefix);
222    }
223
224    /**
225     * Provides a version of the ConsoleIO that outputs to both the console and
226     * the designated file.
227     *
228     * @param linePrefix text to prepend to each line
229     * @param filename   the file to output to
230     *
231     * @return new Display
232     */
233    public static Display consoleFileDisplay(final String linePrefix,
234            final String filename)
235    {
236
237        return new ConsoleIO(linePrefix, filename, true);
238    }
239
240    /**
241     * Provides a version of the ConsoleIO that outputs only to the designated
242     * file.
243     *
244     * @param linePrefix text to prepend to each line
245     * @param filename   the file to output to
246     *
247     * @return new Display
248     */
249    public static Display fileDisplay(final String linePrefix,
250            final String filename)
251    {
252
253        return new ConsoleIO(linePrefix, filename, false);
254    }
255
256    @Override
257    public Display append(final String text)
258    {
259        if (open)
260        {
261            if (!blank && displayOK())
262            {
263                sb.append(text);
264            }
265        } else
266        {
267            exception = new IOException(CLOSED);
268        }
269
270        return this;
271    }
272
273    @Override
274    public void clear()
275    {
276        if (open)
277        {
278            if (!blank)
279            {
280                sb = new StringBuilder();
281                formatter = new Formatter(sb);
282            }
283        } else
284        {
285            sb = null;
286            formatter = null;
287        }
288    }
289
290    @Override
291    public void clearExceptions()
292    {
293        exception = null;
294    }
295
296    @Override
297    public void close() throws IOException
298    {
299        flush();
300
301        if (out != null)
302        {
303            out.close();
304            out = null;
305        }
306
307        if (file != null)
308        {
309            WRITERS.get(WRITERS.indexOf(filename)).removeUsage();
310            file = null;
311        }
312
313        open = false;
314        clear();
315    }
316
317    @Override
318    public void debugLevel(int level)
319    {
320        debugLevel = level;
321    }
322
323    @Override
324    public int debugLevel()
325    {
326        return debugLevel;
327    }
328
329    @Override
330    public void flush()
331    {
332        if (open)
333        {
334            if (out != null || file != null)
335            {
336                if (linePrefix != null && linePrefix.length() > 0)
337                {
338                    List<String> lines = sb.toString().lines().collect(Collectors.toList());
339                    clear();
340
341                    for (int i = 0; i < lines.size(); i++)
342                    {
343                        sb.append(linePrefix).append(lines.get(i)).append(System.lineSeparator());
344                    }
345                }
346
347                if (out != null)
348                {
349                    out.print(sb);
350                    out.flush();
351                }
352
353                if (file != null)
354                {
355                    file.print(sb);
356                    file.flush();
357                }
358
359                clear();
360            }
361        } else
362        {
363            exception = new IOException(CLOSED);
364        }
365    }
366
367    /**
368     * @param format This implementation uses
369     *               {@link Formatter#format(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...)
370     *               Formatter.format(String format, Object... args)}
371     *               as the work-horse.
372     *
373     * @see java.util.Formatter - Format String Syntax
374     */
375    @Override
376    public Display format(String format, Object... args)
377    {
378        if (open && displayOK())
379        {
380            formatter.format(
381                    Locale.getDefault(Locale.Category.FORMAT),
382                    format, args
383            );
384        }
385
386        return this;
387    }
388
389    @Override
390    public boolean isException()
391    {
392        return exception != null;
393    }
394
395    @Override
396    public Display level(int level)
397    {
398        displayLevel = level;
399        return this;
400    }
401
402    @Override
403    public Scanner newScanner()
404    {
405        Scanner rtn = null;
406
407        if (open)
408        {
409            if (console != null)
410            {
411                rtn = new Scanner(console.reader());
412            } else
413            {
414                rtn = new Scanner(System.in);
415            }
416        } else
417        {
418            exception = new IOException(CLOSED);
419        }
420
421        return rtn;
422    }
423
424    @Override
425    public Exception popException()
426    {
427        Exception rtn = exception;
428        clearExceptions();
429        return rtn;
430    }
431
432    @Override
433    public String readLine()
434    {
435        String rtn = null;
436
437        if (open)
438        {
439            if (console != null)
440            {
441                rtn = console.readLine();
442            } else
443            {
444                BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(
445                        new InputStreamReader(System.in));
446                try
447                {
448                    rtn = reader.readLine();
449                } catch (IOException ex)
450                {
451                    exception = ex;
452                }
453            }
454        } else
455        {
456            exception = new IOException(CLOSED);
457        }
458
459        return rtn;
460    }
461
462    @Override
463    public String readLine(String fmt, Object... args)
464    {
465        String rtn = null;
466
467        if (open)
468        {
469            if (console != null)
470            {
471                rtn = console.readLine(fmt, args);
472            } else
473            {
474                println(String.format(fmt, args));
475                BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(
476                        new InputStreamReader(System.in));
477                try
478                {
479                    rtn = reader.readLine();
480                } catch (IOException ex)
481                {
482                    exception = ex;
483                }
484            }
485        } else
486        {
487            exception = new IOException(CLOSED);
488        }
489
490        return rtn;
491    }
492
493    @Override
494    public char[] readPassword()
495    {
496        char[] rtn = null;
497
498        if (open)
499        {
500            if (console != null)
501            {
502                rtn = console.readPassword();
503            } else
504            {
505                String input = readLine();
506                rtn = input != null ? input.toCharArray() : null;
507            }
508        } else
509        {
510            exception = new IOException(CLOSED);
511        }
512
513        return rtn;
514    }
515
516    @Override
517    public char[] readPassword(String fmt, Object... args)
518    {
519        char[] rtn = null;
520
521        if (open)
522        {
523            if (console != null)
524            {
525                rtn = console.readPassword(fmt, args);
526            } else
527            {
528                String input = readLine(fmt, args);
529                rtn = input != null ? input.toCharArray() : null;
530            }
531        } else
532        {
533            exception = new IOException(CLOSED);
534        }
535
536        return rtn;
537
538    }
539
540    private boolean displayOK()
541    {
542        return debugLevel >= displayLevel;
543    }
544
545    /**
546     * Contains a single instance of the {@link PrintWriter} object associated
547     * with the file: {@code filename}.
548     *
549     * @since 1.0.7
550     * @version 1.0.7
551     */
552    private static class WriterInstance implements Closeable
553    {
554
555        /**
556         * Number of references of this instance of {@link PrintWriter} that are
557         * still active.
558         */
559        private int count;
560
561        /**
562         * The filename associated with the {@link #printWriter}.
563         */
564        private final String filename;
565
566        /**
567         * The single instance of this {@link PrintWriter}.
568         */
569        private PrintWriter printWriter;
570
571        /**
572         * Will only be instantiated by parent class.
573         *
574         * @param filename name of file to create/open
575         *
576         * @throws FileNotFoundException If the given string does not denote an
577         *                               existing, writable regular file and a
578         *                               new regular file of that name cannot be
579         *                               created, or if some other error occurs
580         *                               while opening or creating the file
581         *
582         */
583        private WriterInstance(final String filename) throws FileNotFoundException
584        {
585            this.filename = filename;
586            this.printWriter = new PrintWriter(filename);
587            this.count = 1;
588        }
589
590        /**
591         * Increments the usage counter and provides a reference to the single
592         * instance of {@link PrintWriter} stored internally.
593         *
594         * @return reference to {@link PrintWriter}
595         *
596         * @throws IOException if any
597         */
598        public PrintWriter addUsage() throws IOException
599        {
600            if (isOpen())
601            {
602                count++;
603                return printWriter;
604            } else
605            {
606                throw new IOException("PrintWriter closed.");
607            }
608        }
609
610        @Override
611        public void close()
612        {
613            count = 0;
614            printWriter.flush();
615            printWriter.close();
616            printWriter = null;
617        }
618
619        /**
620         * Number of references of this instance of {@link PrintWriter} that are
621         * still active.
622         *
623         * @return count
624         */
625        public int count()
626        {
627            return count;
628        }
629
630        @Override
631        @SuppressWarnings("AccessingNonPublicFieldOfAnotherObject")
632        public boolean equals(Object obj)
633        {
634            if (this == obj)
635            {
636                return true;
637            }
638
639            if (obj == null)
640            {
641                return false;
642            }
643
644            if (getClass() != obj.getClass())
645            {
646                return this.filename.equals(obj);
647            }
648
649            final WriterInstance other = (WriterInstance) obj;
650            return Objects.equals(this.filename, other.filename);
651        }
652
653        /**
654         * The filename associated with the {@link #printWriter}.
655         *
656         * @return filename
657         */
658        public String filename()
659        {
660            return filename;
661        }
662
663        @Override
664        public int hashCode()
665        {
666            return Objects.hashCode(this.filename);
667        }
668
669        /**
670         *
671         * @return {@code true} if open, {@code false} otherwise.
672         */
673        public boolean isOpen()
674        {
675            return printWriter != null;
676        }
677
678        /**
679         * Decrements the usage counter.
680         *
681         * @implSpec
682         * When the counter reaches zero, then the console is closed.
683         */
684        public void removeUsage()
685        {
686            if (isOpen())
687            {
688                --count;
689
690                if (count == 0)
691                {
692                    close();
693                }
694            }
695        }
696    }
697}
